com.project.ardrone_android_geii

Class DroneManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.project.ardrone_android_geii.DroneManager
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    DroneManager_OpenCV

    public class DroneManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Class who handle communication with the Drone (UDP Protocols and AT Commands)

    • Constructor Detail

      • DroneManager

        public DroneManager()

      • DroneManager

        public DroneManager(java.lang.String CommandeStart,
                    java.lang.String Adresse,
                    int iPort,
                    Drone_UI joyActivity)
        This constructor receives as parameter the address and port of the drone to instantiate and a command to send. It instantiates GereThreads class that manages most of the necessary threads in the application and NavdataReceiver class that get drone status and data. It also creates the socket and packet with CreationSocketPacket () function, and starts immediatly WatchDog thread to avoid losing the connection.

    • Method Detail

      • CreationSocketPacket

        public java.net.DatagramSocket CreationSocketPacket(java.lang.String ComandeUDP,
                                                    int port,
                                                    java.lang.String host)
        This method created a socket and a packet. It is performed only once in the constructor of JoyActivity. Indeed, two objects are required for UDP communication, a socket and a packet as respective class DatagramSocket and DatagramPacket (classes available in the Android libraries).
        Parameters:
        ComandeUDP - start command
        port - The Port to use
        host - The Address IP target

      • EnvoiTrameUDP

        public void EnvoiTrameUDP(java.lang.String ComandeUDP)
        This function simply receives the UDP frame to be sent and send it with the socket and packet created with CreationSocketPacket (). It must be executed in a thread.

      • decollage

        public void decollage()
        This function resets the variables (chronometer sequence, flight’s Boolean ..) and then start Piloting threads, which use EnvoiTrameUDP() function to send the AT command.

      • atterissage

        public void atterissage()
        This function stops the steering threads using a boolean, it stops the timer and starts the Atterissage and Watchdog threads (the emergency landing function is the same, only the thread and thus the associated command change).

      • emergency

        public void emergency()

      • AttenteMs

        public void AttenteMs(int iMSeconde)

      • IncrementSeq

        public void IncrementSeq()
